title: The Lab: Bouldering Gym
description: A new bouldering facility at BCIT offering routes for all levels and abilities.

subsections.title: Hours (effective January 8 – May 16)
subsections.description: Closed all statutory holidays. Monday, Tuesday, Thursday: 5:00pm – 8:00pm. Wednesday (BCIT Students & Staff ONLY): 3:00pm – 8:00pm.

subsections.title: Student
subsections.description: Rental Equipment: Free. 1 Day: $10. 10x Pass: $80.

subsections.title: Staff/Alumni
subsections.description: Rental Equipment: $3. 1 Day: $12. 10x Pass: $108. 10x Pass w/ Rentals: $135.

subsections.title: Public
subsections.description: Rental Equipment: $5. 1 Day: $15. 10x Pass: $135. 10x Pass w/ Rentals: $180.

subsections.title: Access
subsections.description: Open to BCIT students and staff during all drop-in times. Wednesdays reserved exclusively for students and staff. Alumni and public access on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday.

title: Research
description: Exploring the relationship between digital tools and social transformation through various research projects.
Examining how digital tools affect individual and collective consciousness and behavior.

section: Agency in Technology Adoption and Use
description: Identifying challenges around agency, choice, and technological adoption, especially for young people.
Investigating design principles for digital tools that support health and education.
Exploring regulatory and policy frameworks that influence the design and use of digital tools.

projects.title: Effects of social media on consciousness
projects.description: Studying social media's impact on values and decision-making among young people in urban aboriginal families.

projects.title: Language-learning technology and newcomer integration
projects.description: Exploring how technology affects language and social integration for youth refugees.

projects.title: Digital tools and youth mental health
projects.description: Assessing the impact of digital tools on youth mental health from a public health perspective.

title: Digital Tools and Social Transformation Collaboration
description: Exploring how technology impacts social transformation through interdisciplinary research.
Investigating the cycle of using technology to solve problems and the new issues it creates.
An interdisciplinary, multi-institutional research lab involving BCIT, UBC, UVic, SFU, and community partners.

questions: Are we designing technology to support the world we want to live in?
What are alternative approaches to innovation in a technologically sophisticated world?

subsections.description: 3700 Willingdon Ave., Burnaby, BC, Canada V5G 3H2

title: Flexible Learning Programs - Private Medical Insurance
description: Medical insurance requirement and options for international students in flexible learning programs at BCIT.
Medical insurance is mandatory for admissions. Students must submit proof of coverage by their program start date.

section: How to Submit Proof (Students New to Canada)
description: Purchase temporary insurance via Guard.me, submit proof of coverage, and apply for BC MSP.

section: How to Submit Proof (Students Already in Canada)
description: Submit proof of MSP enrollment via email to international_flex@bcit.ca.
Add dependents to Guard.me insurance policy online after receiving your Policy #.

subsections.title: Address
subsections.description: 3700 Willingdon Ave., Burnaby, BC, Canada V5G 3H2

title: Private Medical Insurance for International Students
description: Medical insurance options and requirements for international students at BCIT.
International students must have private basic medical insurance for any period not covered by the BC Medical Services Plan (MSP).
BCIT’s preferred private medical insurance provider for international students. Automatic enrollment for full-time students, ISEP, and Exchange programs, with an opt-out option.

subsections.title: Address
subsections.description: 3700 Willingdon Ave., Burnaby, BC, Canada V5G 3H2

title: Opportunities for Indigenous Initiatives
description: Current employment and educational opportunities for Indigenous students and community members at BCIT.
Short-term job opportunities via Grizzly Force, accessible through a smartphone app.
Full-time or part-time position with Learning Buddies Network, providing mentoring for elementary students in need. Compensation ranges from $24.00 to $35.00 per hour.

title: Advanced Additive Manufacturing Technology Hub
description: Provides research and development services for 3D printing of advanced composites, metals, engineering thermoplastics, and food. Enhances knowledge and prototyping capabilities of students, faculty, and industry partners.

title: Building Science Centre of Excellence
description: Research activities focus on the performance of buildings, including durability and energy performance, and healthy indoor environments. Facilities include various testing laboratories.

title: Centre for Applied Research and Innovation
description: Home to BCIT’s research groups: MAKE+, NRG, and SMART, focusing on product and process development, Smart Microgrid research, and natural health and food products.

title: Centre for Architectural Ecology
description: Evaluates the function and performance of green roofs and living walls through collaborations with industry, government, and academic partners.

title: Digital Tools and Social Transformation Collaboration
description: An interdisciplinary research lab focusing on public health, education, social sciences, engineering, and computing systems.

title: Centre for Ecocities
description: Supports the evolution of ecocities worldwide, providing tools, metrics, planning, policy advice, and training for sustainable urban development.

title: Centre for Internet of Things
description: Focuses on the integration and application of IoT technology in various fields, making the world smarter and more responsive.

title: Diversity Circles
description: Proposes an Indigenous model for post-secondary engagement in diversity, providing panels, workshops, and tools for community-based expertise.

title: Emission Reduction and Research Test Hub
description: A research facility focusing on vehicle emissions measurement, testing solutions, and improving air quality in collaboration with industry and government.

title: Polytechnic Research Institute for Simulation and Multimedia
description: Develops and researches simulation technologies like AR, VR, and MR to support teaching and learning across multiple disciplines.

title: Rehabilitation Engineering Design Lab
description: Focuses on developing technologies to improve interaction with built and natural environments, and promote health and community participation for those with disabilities.

title: Remotely Piloted Aircraft Systems Hub
description: Collaborative Centre for education, training, and research in drone technology, integrating various fields like surveying and emergency response.

title: Rivers Institute
description: Focuses on the protection and restoration of aquatic ecosystems, providing education, community guidance, and applied research.

title: Spartan Controls Centre for Energy Education and Research
description: Facility focused on energy production, distribution, sustainability, and management, featuring a multi-fuel boiler and an electrical generator.

title: Technology Place
description: Offers customizable office and laboratory space for tenants in life sciences, software, hardware, cleantech, and digital media sectors.

title: Research Support Fund
description: The Research Support Fund assists Canadian post-secondary institutions with the indirect costs associated with managing their research enterprise, helping them maintain a world-class research environment.

subsections.title: Research Facilities
subsections.description: Maintain modern labs and equipment.

subsections.title: Research Resources
subsections.description: Provide access to up-to-date knowledge resources.

subsections.description: Administration of an institution’s research enterprise.

subsections.description: Meet regulatory and ethical standards.

subsections.title: Intellectual Property
subsections.description: Transfer knowledge from academia to the private, public and not-for-profit sectors.

title: BCIT Student Housing
description: BCIT offers student housing on its Burnaby Campus, featuring seven low-rise buildings with fully equipped suites and various amenities.

subsections.title: Application Process
subsections.description: Applications for Long-stay Housing open February 28th, 2024.

subsections.title: Bursary Details
subsections.description: Financial aid for housing costs, valued at $500-$1,000, for eligible students.

subsections.title: Housing Features
subsections.description: Each suite has 12 bedrooms, shared kitchens, and living areas.

title: Policies & Collective Agreements
description: BCIT's policies and collective agreements for various employee groups, including BCGEU support staff, BCGEU faculty, faculty and staff association, and management.

subsections.title: Management Compensation Policy & Executive Compensation Summary

title: BCIT Alumni Association AGM
description: The BCIT Alumni Association Annual General Meeting features updates and presentations for alumni. It includes highlights from the past year and panel discussions.

subsections.title: 2023 AGM Highlights
subsections.description: Participants discussed entrepreneurial mindset and reviewed the annual report.

subsections.title: 2022 AGM
subsections.description: Keynote by Manpreet Dhillon on equity and inclusion.

subsections.title: 2021 AGM
subsections.description: AGM & Cocktail Class with highlights from the past year.

subsections.title: 2020 AGM
subsections.description: Panel on lessons learned from COVID-19.

title: Institute Reporting: Cognos
description: Cognos is the enterprise reporting tool used at BCIT for generating and delivering reports based on information from Banner. It provides role-based access to reporting and allows departments to create their own reports or request assistance.

title: BCIT Alumni Association AGM
description: Join the BCIT Alumni Association for their Annual General Meeting. This event is an opportunity to engage with the alumni community, review the year's achievements, and plan for the future.

title: Forensic Science & Technology
description: BCIT's Forensic Science & Technology programs offer comprehensive training combining science and technology with legal studies. Students gain hands-on experience in forensic labs and computer facilities, preparing them for careers in justice and public safety.

title: Sustainability at BCIT
description: BCIT's sustainability initiatives integrate sustainability into education, research, campus operations, and community engagement. The programs aim to advance sustainable practices and foster a culture of sustainability.

description: The BCIT Board of Governors is responsible for the overall governance and strategic direction of the institution.

title: Program Change
description: The BCIT program change process ensures programs remain responsive and current, aligning with stakeholder needs through collaborative and consultative efforts.

description: The BCIT Centre for Architectural Ecology offers courses on green roofs, green walls, and building environment and climate. These courses integrate research and technology transfer through academic programs and professional development.

title: Research Infrastructure
description: The Centre for Architectural Ecology at BCIT supports research into green roofs, living walls, and other living architecture technologies through a variety of specialized labs and regional projects.

title: Research Projects
description: The Centre for Architectural Ecology at BCIT conducts research on climate-adaptive architecture, urban heat island effects, outdoor thermal comfort, air pollution, and nature-based building systems.

title: Centre for Architectural Ecology
description: The Centre for Architectural Ecology supports the academic, design, and construction communities to understand the connection between buildings and the urban environment through nature. It advances living architecture systems and technologies through collaborative research.

title: About the Centre for Architectural Ecology
description: The Centre for Architectural Ecology focuses on collaborations in living architecture and building science, situated in urban contexts. Established in 2003, it engages in applied research, education, and industry collaborations.

subsections.title: Establishment
subsections.description: Founded by Dr. Maureen Connelly in 2003 at the Great Northern Way campus.

subsections.title: Research Phases
subsections.description: Initial green roof research (2002-2007), expanded research (2007-2010) including native plants, living walls, and acoustical characterization.

subsections.title: Move to Burnaby
subsections.description: Moved to BCIT Burnaby campus in 2010, coinciding with the opening of the Graduate Program in Building Science.

subsections.title: Living Architecture Lab
subsections.description: Research on stormwater mitigation, thermal efficiency of green roofs, and performance evaluation across BC.

subsections.title: Collaborations
subsections.description: Supports academic, design, and construction communities in understanding the building-urban environment connection through research.

subsections.title: Green Roof Courses
subsections.description: Popular among professionals, qualifying for learning units from various institutes.

subsections.title: Building Environment and Climate Courses
subsections.description: Serving graduate and undergraduate programs, open for professional development.
